metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5059 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Type confusion in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 58.0.3029.81 for Linux, Windows, and Mac, and 58.0.3029.83 for Android, allowed a remote attacker to potentially obtain code execution via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5059` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350').
